The key idea is that the smaller tetrahedron is similar to the original one, so the ratio of their volumes will be the cube of the ratio of their corresponding side lengths.

The next step is to determine the ratio of the side lengths of the smaller tetrahedron to the original one. This requires understanding the geometric relationship between the original tetrahedron and the tetrahedron formed by its face centers.

[OUTPUT] Determine the ratio of the side lengths of the smaller tetrahedron to the original tetrahedron.
